Junior linebackerOgbonnia Okoronkwo makes his way to the pocket during the game against Kansas State Oct PERIOD  PERIOD Okoronkwo had three solo tackles in the game PERIOD

Former Oklahoma outside linebacker Ogbonnia Okoronkwo and offensive lineman Bobby Evans won Super Bowl LVI with the Los Angeles Rams on Sunday night despite the efforts of fellow former Sooners Joe Mixon and Samaje Perine of the Cincinnati Bengals PERIOD

Mixon formerly an OU running back from  ran the ball  times for  yards and added five receptions for one yard PERIOD He also completed one pass for six yards and a touchdown on a trick play that swung the momentum Cincinnatis way early in the eventual  loss PERIOD

With just under six minutes left in the second quarter Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow pitched the ball backward to Mixon who then completed a 6yard pass to receiver Tee Higgins in the back of the end zone shrinking the Rams lead to only four points PERIOD

That was cool PERIOD SuperBowl on NBC pic.twitter.comQtR4XPQKLx

Okoronkwo finished the contest with one total tackle and Bobby Evans and the Rams offensive line allowed only two sacks on the night PERIOD Perine also ran the ball two times for zero yards PERIOD Former OU linebacker Jordan Evans of the Bengals did not suit up due to injury PERIOD

title: Sooners in the NFL: Ogbonnia Okoronkwo, Bobby Evans win Super Bowl LVI despite Joe Mixon's TD pass | Sports | oudaily.com
